content.raw:
I think the failures occur during teardown when the world has a pr2. I see the following error message:

~~~
$ gzserver --verbose worlds/pr2.world --iters 1000
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 8.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2016 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.91
[Err] [server_main.cc:54] Ogre Error:OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException):
 MovableObjectFactory of type Frustum does not exist in Root::getMovableObjectFactory
 at /build/buildd/ogre-1.8-1.8.1+dfsg/OgreMain/src/OgreRoot.cpp (line 1480)
~~~
content.html:
I think the failures occur during teardown when the world has a pr2. I see the following error message:

$ gzserver --verbose worlds/pr2.world --iters 1000
Gazebo multi-robot simulator, version 8.0.0
Copyright (C) 2012-2016 Open Source Robotics Foundation.
Released under the Apache 2 License.
http://gazebosim.org

[Msg] Waiting for master.
[Msg] Connected to gazebo master @ http://127.0.0.1:11345
[Msg] Publicized address: 172.23.2.91
[Err] [server_main.cc:54] Ogre Error:OGRE EXCEPTION(5:ItemIdentityException):
 MovableObjectFactory of type Frustum does not exist in Root::getMovableObjectFactory
 at /build/buildd/ogre-1.8-1.8.1+dfsg/OgreMain/src/OgreRoot.cpp (line 1480)
